title: Info on Shaco rework
body: I'm looking for info on the Shaco rework. Shaco's my most played, best, and favorite champion and I'm really hoping all this talk about a rework is just speculation. Is there any solid proof that he's being looked at? If so, what exactly are their plans for him? ETA on an announcement date? Do they plan on focusing on his AD assassin style or his AP anti-engage style? Anything? The only info I can find is random people on the boards saying he's slated for a rework.

replies.body:
We don't have a Shaco rework in progress at the moment, or one scheduled. We did have some opportunistic, experimental work being done a couple of years ago, that didn't hit the mark however so it got shelved.

As far as your suggestions below go adding a visible timer for Shaco to the clone seems like a good and easy to implement idea, I'll pass that one on tomorrow, see if there's anything stopping us throwing it into an upcoming patch. Changes to things like spell effect application, fear behavior, monster blind etc by contrast are still reasonable suggestions, but things that would need to be part of a larger piece of work which at least at the moment we're not in a position to prioritize (primary focus right now's on preseason stuff). Also some game health issues with Shaco we'd need to work on, or conclude were acceptable costs, before we'd be happy adding any power to him.

Awesome! Good news all around. I do have to ask though, the one thing you avoided bringing up is his clone getting any visual buffs that Shaco currently has, things like Red, Blue, and Baron buff. I understand the other things would be giving Shaco free power, but I don't think that'd be the case for adding the visuals to the clone. There would still be many ways to tell the difference, clicking on either Shaco or the Clone will still tell you which is which, the real one will still have the buff 'Hallucination' and the fake would still lack it and any other buffs, the fake one still won't be able to cast spells, and the real one will still always appear facing in the same direction he was facing when the spell was cast. It just seems silly that champions like Shaco, Wukong, and Leblanc are basically punishing themselves for getting red, blue, and baron.

Hmm, there are some technical issues that make duplicating all the buffs and debuffs from Shaco on the clone tricky. Special casing the appearance of red, blue and baron buff's should be pretty straightforward though. I'll look into that, and see what's up with the Hallucination buff if that's showing up (can't see a reason it should). Facing giving away which is which is also something it should be possible to at least improve too.

Closing the loop on this barring unforseen bugs patch 5.22 should have:

* Shaco's clone facing randomized on spawn (instead of always facing the same direction)
* Fake versions (visual only) of blue, red and baron buff for Shaco, Wukong and Le Blanc clones
* A timer for Shaco's clone remaining duration (only visible to Shaco).
dont forget to add elixirs effects to clones while you guys are at it.

Just something to remind, CaptainGankplang said elixirs, but those aren't the only things. Elixirs, smite buffs in jungle, dragon buff (faint yellow/orange glow), lichbane/sheen (probably not something that may go through). as someone with nearly 140k mastery with shaco, I think shaco is mostly fine where he's at but there are a few sort of bugs that really bother me. For one, his Two-shiv gets canceled mid-animation when somebody goes out of vision which is extremely frustrating. The second thing is that once in awhile(quite rare) the ghosts from frost queen will hit me even when I am invisible, from my understanding they're only suppose to reveal me if they hit me BEFORE I deceive. I have a friend that also plays shaco but in diamond who is also quite frustrated with these same things. Even when frost queen works correctly and doesn't reveal me while I'm stealthed, it makes things extremely difficult for a shaco especially now that mid laners are also building it...Two frost queens is just too much.

If a Shaco rework of any size isn't within the predictable future (Though I do love what this patch has touched up on) would it be reasonable to presume that an "Assassins" patch is going to come at some point in the future (Perhaps within the next year or so?) that has touch ups to a number of assassins to bring them in line with potential items and to create more versatility in kits? (Similar to the Juggernaut and Marksman Patches)

Or you could like uhh click him and check his items and or stats. Most people aren't good at managing clone either so it's pretty easy to tell the difference. Clone can't use abilities either. You got so many options dude

Skirmish's. Not everyone is aware you can click him and not everyone does it in the middle of a fight or remembers to anyway. It's the fact you get punished for using your ult.

When discussing balance we should consider higher level play, and there they will know enough to click on shaco to know which one is the clone. His opponents being bad isn't a strength of shaco. Using your ult is hardly getting punished, its still an added dps source (it still AA) and an AOE bomb when it expires. You can argue it isn't as good as other ults but i don't think its actively punishing you in any way.

I will have to disagree with the OP a bit here, seeing which one has the red/blue buffs provides some counterplay to shaco. Copying the buff, even if just visually, would remove that and add power to him as a champion at the potential cost of making him _more_ frustrating to play against which is arguably already his worst problem.

How is that counterplay? That's not you doing anything to outplay shaco, that's Shaco counterplaying himself by doing something he's supposed to do. If you wanna counterplay Shaco, there's many ways to tell the difference. Ping shaco as soon as you see him, when he ults, the ping will remain. Click on shaco or the clone, the clone will not have buffs listed, shaco will. Stick shaco with a debuff before he ults, the one with the debuff is the real one. Shaco will always be facing the same direction  as when he ulted. The clone takes more damage and deals less. Noticing any of those things is counterplay, noticing he has red buff is a bug that should have been fixed long ago.

I have had many ideas on Shaco over the past years and I greatly appreciate you Meddler for giving us info on the changes to him.

I would be pleased if you would read over my below comments on him {{champion:35}} 




PASSIVE-BACKSTAB
Shaco deals 20% bonus damage when striking an enemy from behind with his basic attacks or Two-Shiv Poison.png Two-Shiv Poison.


Q- DECEIVE     
PASSIVE: While DECEIVE is not on cooldown, Shaco's basic attacks poison his targets, Slow icon slowing them for 2 seconds.
ACTIVE: Shaco instantly blinks to the target location and stealths for up to 3.5 seconds, also causing his next basic attack within 6 seconds to slow for 2.5 seconds.
SLOW: 10 / 15 / 20 / 25 / 30%

W-JACK IN THE BOX		
No major changes

E-TWO-SHIV POISON	
PASSIVE: Minion and Monster miss chance: 20 / 22.5 / 25 / 27.5 / 30% (Doesn't Deactivate)
ACTIVE: Shaco throws up to two daggers at the target enemy, dealing magic damage. Both thrown daggers apply on-hit effects.
MAGIC DAMAGE: 30 / 55 / 80 / 105 / 130 (+ 100% AP) (+ 100% bonus AD) 

R-Hallucinate
No major changes


- His E seems to be used as a way to secure kills when enemies are running- which is great, but the slow portion of it normally doesn't last long enough to catch up with the target.

I feel like this might not be optimal for his kit. It seems like it would flow better if the slow portion of his E is applied to his Q. That way if he uses his Q ( For surprise or as a gap closer) he can slow for a second or two but sacrifices his perma slow. This seems to make more sense and I feel it would have more competitive play. 

Another thought- if the E's damage was lowered, but he was given 2 shiv instead of one (since he has a shiv in each hand); I think his play would be more fun.


Also, I feel like his W fear and box priority could use a little changing when it comes to fighting champions.

Let me know what you think, and take an and leave whatever you might could use :D

P.S. On a side note, I have slowed my play on him because his scaling isn't great. Right now Vi, Hec, Kha or Rengar all can assasinate and are so much more valuable late game.

I know you probably can't do this soon, but can you make it so the clone also appears to have red/blue buff?  It's a bit silly to be punished for clearing you own jungle by being unable trick anyone with your ultimate.
